intro: Pluchea quitoc, commonly known as the Andean groundcherry, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly the Andean regions. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has small, hairy leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. The plant is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
